Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, I hear we have a new heading! Do we have a new assignment?
Well... yes, I suppose you could say that.
C'est fantastique! What adventure do we have in store for us this time?
That is a... question...
And the answer is?

Fields.MenuText: I don’t want to tell you. I’m not sure you can handle it.
I can't tell you. It's classified.
I would tell you, but I don't know myself.

Fields.DialogueText: What do you mean? I can handle anything. Have you met me?
Classified? Surely you must be joking. That just makes me want to know more!
Well, that can't be true. You, at least, must know where we're going.
Why won't you tell me, Capitaine?!
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. Morganas are headed this direction.
Merde! The worst timing! Let's go.
I'm going to have to tell her the bad news eventually, but... maybe there's a way to soften the blow.
@BATTLE
Are we going to defeat a terrifying Morgana?
Are we going to rescue survivors from a town destroyed by Morganas?
Are we going to sneak into a nest of Morganas, disguised as one of them, only to blow them all up from the inside?!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not even sure how that would work.
Yep, you got it, Dunkerque. Well done.
Stop guessing already!

Fields.DialogueText: C'est simple, Capitaine! We must cover ourselves with Morgana scraps.
Really? No, that was too easy. I must keep guessing.
Ooh, that got a reaction out of you! I must be getting close.
Even if you get it right, I'm not going to tell you.
But why not? I want to know. Tell me. S'il vous plaît?
You don't like surprises?
Non, surprises can be fun. But sometimes, it's more fun to know. So tell me.
Dîtes-moi! Come, Capitaine, you must tell me!
*ALARM*
Thank goodness.
@BATTLE
Okay, Capitaine, are we going to...
I'm going to stop you right there. If you keep guessing, I'm going to actually tell you.
Merveilleuse! That's exactly what I want.
That would completely ruin the surprise of it, though. Is that really what you want?
Hmmm... well. I... I think I want to know. Are you trying to confuse me, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: I would never dream of it.
That depends. Is it working?
Oh, I'm just going to tell you. We're going to...

Fields.DialogueText: Bien. You would have to wake quite early to fool me, Capitaine!
Non. I... I still want to know... I'm mostly sure of it.
Interrompre! I need to think about this for a second.
Is this a good surprise or a bad surprise?
I can't tell you.
Gah! What to do, what to do...?
*ALARM*
I'd say take your time, but it doesn't look like we have any.
That's Morganas for you.
@BATTLE
Morganas really do have horrible timing.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
Dunkerque, I have...
Capitaine, I've been expecting you.
Expecting me?
I've been putting a lot of thought into this matter. Do I really want to know, or do I want to be surprised? I believe I've come up with an answer.

Fields.MenuText: You're putting a lot of effort into this.
And that answer is?
You're a little late here, Dunkerque.

Fields.DialogueText: It's the only way I know how to do anything.
Well, you're not one to beat around the bush, are you?
I know it took some time to come to a decision, but I needed to be sure.
I want to know. Surprises be damned!
Dunkerque...
And you *will* tell me this time, Capitaine. I'm not letting you keep your mouth shut.
I don't have to...
Even if I have to pry it out of you by force. I'll do it.
Dunkerque, we're already here. Just turn around.
Huh? Merde! Don't you think we're a little too close to land, Capitaine?
That's the point. How else are you going to be able to enjoy the beach?
Quoi?! You mean this was the surprise? A beach trip?!
In a manner of speaking. Several important convoys are due to pass through this area, and Command wants us to keep an eye on things.
But as far as missions are concerned, this one should be pretty relaxed, so there should be plenty of time for you and the crew to soak up the sun. Happy?
En extase! I need to go get my things!
Dunkerque, aren't you ready yet?
I would have been ready had someone given me proper warning.

Fields.MenuText: You liked the surprise.
Well, excuse me. I won't make that mistake again.
If I had known you'd take this long to get ready, I would have given you a few weeks' notice.

Fields.DialogueText: It was a very nice surprise. Merci.
No, I liked it. You're pretty good at surprises.
You'll be thanking me later when my preparations come in handy.
All right, I think I'm just about ready.
You're bringing a basket full of... what is all that stuff?
Pas tant que ça. A few beach towels, some spare clothing, extra ammunition, and all of my beauty supplies.
Shells, makeup, and beach towels? That's certainly a variety.
I'm prepared for anything.
*ALARM*
Anything?
What do you think the ammunition is for?
@BATTLE
This is wonderful, Capitaine. Sunbathing on the beach is such a different experience from laying on the deck.
I wouldn't know. The deck is for working, not relaxing.
I know that, but sometimes the weather is just so nice. It's important to enjoy it.

Fields.MenuText: I will admit, it's pretty nice to take a break like this.
There will be plenty of time to enjoy the weather when the Morganas are gone.
I wish I could, but I'm the captain. I'm a little too busy to take time off.

Fields.DialogueText: Bien sûr! And this is just the start of our beach activities!
Don't be like that. If we can't live our lives while the Morganas are here, then they might as well have already won.
I didn't realise you were so weighed down with responsibilities. Maybe I should help out more around the ship to take some of that weight off your shoulders.
I'm starting to think, more and more, that we really needed some time to lay in the sun.
Maybe you're right. Everyone certainly looks like they're enjoying themselves.
Mmmm, I certainly am...
It's just... It's hard to get a tan when there's a battleship blocking the sun.
You do have quite an impressive shadow, don't you?
Pft. I just wish we could've dropped anchor a little further away.
The only way you can relax on the beach is if the ship is close by. Plus, this way, we can keep an ear out for the alarm.
I know, I know. A girl can wish, though.
*ALARM*
And Morganas can attack that girl while she's busy wishing in the sun.
Should I leave the towels here, or...?
We'll be back soon enough.
Good! I'll just grab my extra ammo, then...
@BATTLE
Enjoying some volleyball, Dunkerque?
Phew, it's beach volleyball. The beach makes it more fun!
I can see that. You're not running the crew too ragged, are you?
Nah, they're doing great. They've had me giving it my all. I can't wait for the next game.

Fields.MenuText: They look pretty exhausted to me. Maybe you should go a little easy on them.
Is it really that fun? I've never played before.
How have you hardly broken a sweat? You were running and jumping all over the place.

Fields.DialogueText: Never. It's no fun if everyone isn't trying their best!
You've never played?! How is that possible? Were you raised in a bunker?
I'm working up a sweat. I'm just having too much fun to get tired!
You should join us for the next game, Capitaine! You'd be a welcome addition.
I'm not sure about that...
Nonsense! Okay, everyone, the Capitaine is joining us! Get ready for the next match!
*ALARM*
Dammit, never mind!
I'm sure you can start your next game after we've finished with these Morganas, okay?
I think you mean that you're sure we can start our next game after we've finished with these Morganas. Right?
@BATTLE
How do you like my sandcastle, Capitaine? The seashell ornamentation gives it a certain je ne sais quoi, don't you think?

Fields.MenuText: You don't think the moat is a little much?
It's really well made. You certainly put a lot of effort into it.
How did you do that? Did you bring extra tools or something? Is this some sort of Belle trick?

Fields.DialogueText: How else am I supposed to protect all the little sand citizens from the tide?
Thank you. I tried to make the castle I'd want to live in. You know, if a battleship could fit in a castle.
Just a shovel and pail! I have a knack for this, I think.
How's your castle looking?
Not nearly as impressive as yours.
Oh, it's cute. I like it. It's very you, Capitaine.
What's that supposed to mean?
Ha! Nothing, of course.
Capitaine, I'm so happy we've had this opportunity. It's been such a nice little vacation in amongst all the fighting.
I'm glad you're enjoying yourself. I'm sure the coming days will be just as pleasant.
Yeah, it's... huh. How long is this vacation going to last, Capitaine?
What do you mean?
We've been out here for a while, and these waters have been relatively calm.
Will we be moving on soon? Would our time be better spent... hunting down vicious Morganas, or something to that effect?
*ALARM*
Ummm, see? Right there. We're fighting Morganas.
I get the feeling you're not telling me something, Capitaine.
All I have to say is that we need to go protect our sandcastles from the Morgana menace. Let's go.
@BATTLE
These... buckets are... heavier than I thought they'd be.
Dunkerque, what are those buckets full of? Are those crabs?
Mhmmm. I went shellfish diving! Guess what we're having for dinner tonight.

Fields.MenuText: Crab sounds pretty good, I'll admit.
I was actually hoping for something sweeter today. Maybe ice cream.
I can't stand shellfish, so I can tell you what I'm not eating.

Fields.DialogueText: Great! Oh, and we can have a beach bonfire and cook them up like that! We can make a whole night of it!
Ice cream for dinner? You're mad, Capitaine. But you know what would be even crazier? Both ice cream and crab for dinner.
Then what did I catch all these guys for? I hope the crew will enjoy them, at least.
All this talk of food is making me hungry. It might be mealtime already.
Sure, and while we're eating, we can talk about how you're always keeping things from me.
Excuse me?
I've noticed a pattern, Capitaine. You seem to enjoy keeping things from me, and I don't like it. It's time for you to tell me the truth.
I don't know what you're talking about.
How is this beach vacation the best use of our time in the middle of a war?
*ALARM*
Clearly, there are threats in the area. Let's get to work.
Damn Morganas. Always showing up when it's most inconvenient.
... Inconvenient for you, maybe.
What was that? Did you say something?!
@BATTLE
Why did I let you do this to me?
Because I begged and asked nicely.
You also said it would be fun to get buried up to my neck. So far... this isn't fun.
You can't say you're not having even a little bit of fun.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I might be having a little fun. Though I'm mostly looking forward to burying you next.
Not at all. I feel like this must be what a mushroom sees all day. It's a strange perspective.
Are you having fun? This all just seems odd to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, that definitely sounds like fun, but you have to wait your turn.
A mushroom? What kind of mushroom grows on a beach?
Well, I guess I'm just a odd girl, because I'm having the time of my life.
Just wait. All the real fun will start after you're packed in there.
I don't think you can pack me any further. I can feel sand in between my toes. As well as... well... everywhere.
Good. Now try to get out.
How? Hhgggh. I'm stuck.
Oh, that's right, I buried you standing. You're gonna need some help to get out, then.
What's with that smile? I've never seen you smile so menacingly before.
I want answers, Capitaine. Why are we spending our time on a beach? Not that I'm complaining. It just seems too good to be true.
Oh, so this is what you were planning? I'll just wait for someone to wander by and help. I can wait you out all day.
*ALARM*
Oh, look at that. Sounds like Morganas are approaching to attack. Seems like the kind of thing we'd need our capitaine for.
Dammit. Did you plan this?
You're not the only one who can use Morgana appearances to their advantage. Now talk!
... Okay... fine. Just don't shoot the messenger, okay?
What do you mean?
Word of your defeat in the yacht race has been spreading. It's a ridiculous reason, but you've been removed from the front lines because of... bad press.
What? But... I only lost because I was fighting Morganas.
I know. It's politics, I'm afraid.
*ALARM*
Stupid politics and stupid Morganas. I need to shoot something.
Uh, wait, Dunkerque. I'm still buried in a hole. Can you dig me out here? Hello?!
@BATTLE
That's not the point, Dunkerque.
Dunkerque, why aren't you out on the beach?
The beach doesn't seem as fun anymore. Why did you have to tell me such horrible news at such a nice place?

Fields.MenuText: I was hoping it wouldn't seem so bad if you were having fun.
I guess I wasn't thinking.
Excuse me, but I seem to remember you forcing me to tell you.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, next time, just rip the bandage off. If you had done that, you could've cheered me up at the beach.
I suppose I shouldn't have expected you to think before acting. It would've been out of character.
Really? All I remember is heartbreak.
I'm sorry... I think I may be getting a little dramatic. I just can't believe that Command doesn't want me fighting Morganas on the front lines because I lost a silly race.
A race with some of the most influential gossips I've ever met.
This is the worst!
It's not like they're decommissioning you. Here in the next few days, another Belle will surely do something headline-grabbing, and Command will forget about the race entirely.
J'ai l'impression qu'ils me laissent sur l'étagère. I feel like command is leaving me on the shelf. Like some old rifle.
*ALARM*
If they were, then we wouldn't be seconds away from another fight.
Dunkerque...
@BATTLE
Ouch.
Dunkerque, you're back on the beach. That's good to see.
I decided I'm not going to let this get me down. If Command's going to leave me on the shelf, then I may as well take advantage of it.
You're not on the sidelines, you're just assigned to a mission of less... importance.
That hardly makes me feel better, Capitaine. But it doesn't matter. I'm determined to enjoy my time here. I'm already starting to see the bright side.

Fields.MenuText: A bright side? Like what?
That's more like the Dunkerque I know. I knew you'd be back to your old self before long.
Good, that's why I brought you to the beach. You should be enjoying yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, like... just look around you! We're surrounded by bright sides! This beach is gorgeous!
I just had to flip my perspective on things a little. This is actually a good thing.
And I am. And I will continue to do so.
All right, if the higher-ups are going to believe what some gossips have to say about me, then it's their loss. Let's have a beach party!
*ALARM*
You don't think they're here for the party, do you?
Maybe we can send them an invitation. Attached to a shell.
@BATTLE
All right, Capitaine, I hope you've enjoyed your last day on the beach.
Last day? Are you already tired of the beach? I was just starting to get a tan.
We've spent far too much time here. The convoys have long since passed us by. We're aimless and without a true goal. Let's take advantage of it!
What are you talking about?
We have an ocean in front of us that we're free to explore. Until Command reassigns us, we're free to go where the wind takes us. Doesn't that sound amazing?!

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like a good way to get lost.
Sounds like an adventure waiting to happen.
You sound really excited right now.

Fields.DialogueText: We won't get lost. I know what I'm doing, Capitaine. Have a little faith.
Exactly. Let's go out and find some adventures of our own!
I should. If I'm being honest, this is the kind of opportunity I've always wanted.
Get ready to ship out. We have a world to explore, Capitaine. What are we waiting for?
It's hard to argue with that. Especially when you seem so resolved.
Then don't argue. Come on, hurry up or I'm leaving without you!
Uh, that's called a mutiny. And that's not something you joke about.
Hehe, who said I was joking?
Very well, have it your way. We'd never make it past the Morganas without you, so it isn't in my best interest to argue.
We'll likely run into a few enemies as we head back out to sea. Allow me to further prove my worth!
@BATTLE
All right, Dunkerque, we have the ocean in front of us. Where are we going?
Erm... je ne sais pas. You're the capitaine. You pick.

Fields.MenuText: I'm the captain. Don't tell me what to do.
This was your idea. You should be leading the way.
Okay? I guess I can pick our next destination.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm the ship. Don't tell me not to tell you what to do.
That... Non. I'd rather prefer not to. I can lead, but I trust your vision.
Just make sure it's not anywhere boring. Or somewhere we've been before.
You're telling me you really had us head out without any destination in mind?
Freedom was the destination!
Uh-huh, I got that. But you didn't have anything more specific?
Non... see, this is why you're the capitaine and I'm the ship. You're better at the whole commanding and leading thing. So lead us somewhere fun!
It's not as easy as you make it seem.
That's all right, Capitaine. Je crois en vous. I believe in you.
I still don't know where you actually want us to go!
*ALARM*
How about somewhere without any Morganas?
Now that's a tall order.
@BATTLE
So, with this newfound freedom of ours, what exactly do you want to do?
Hmm... well. Liberté is an ideal of France, but... it is not something I am used to. Je ne suis pas sûr. I'm not sure.
All right. Is there anything you want to do right now?
What don't I want to do? I want to sail the seas, I want to slay some Morganas, perhaps plund... err... hunt for some treasure? There are lots of things I want to do.

Fields.MenuText: Well, if you want to sail the seas, it's a good thing you're a ship.
Aren't you tired of fighting Morganas? We do it all the time.
What was that last one? Plunder treasure? Or hunting for treasure?

Fields.DialogueText: By that I mean that I want to explore the world. There are so many places I haven't seen.
There's a certain surge of adrenaline I get from fighting. It feels good. You don't get that too, Capitaine?
Hunting, of course! Plunder. You must be hearing things. I have always loved the idea of hunting for treasure, Capitaine.
I'm sorry if I seem a little scattered. I'm not making this easy for you, am I, Capitaine?
It's fine. Just... on this massive list of things you want to do, what's at the top?
Hmmm... I suppose I really want to see a new land. Let's go to a city I've never seen!
That's a start! Which one?
I just made a decision. Now I have to make another one?
We're almost done. Do you want to go to Canada, Mex...
That one. Canada. Let's go to Canada!
You're just choosing that one because it's the first country I listed, aren't you?
Does it matter? I have spoken. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Capitaine, look toward the south. I think that's a Morgana fleet!
It looks like it. And she seems to have set her sights set on some poor merchant vessel.
Well, we have to hurry in and help, don't we?

Fields.MenuText: Definitely. We can't just watch from the sidelines.
Lead the way, Dunkerque.
Do we have to? I'm sure they can handle it.

Fields.DialogueText: It's time to save the day!
No, you lead the way. You're the capitaine. You know I don't want to lead.
Le sarcasme est indigne de vous, Capitaine. It really doesn't suit an officer of your stature at all.
*BOOM*
A direct hit! The merchant vessel is taking on water.
The survivors will need our help. There's no time to lose.
And we can chase the Morganas off, too!
@BATTLE
It was just a figure of speech.
Capitaine, I think we have turned the tide!
They do appear to be retreating. Make it stick!
@BATTLE
Thank you, Captain. You arrived just in time.
I wish we could've arrived a little sooner. We might have been able to save your ship.
Yes, that would've been preferable. Though in truth, the real loss is the cargo.
The cargo? Were you carrying something special?
Valuable crates of goods. And we were almost at port, too. Oh well, I suppose we should just be thankful we escaped with our lives. Thank you again, Captain.
It was nothing.
Capitaine? Look... at the vessel.
Did we miss a survivor or something?
Non, we have a full accounting... but the merchantman... she should be sinking, but she is not.
Interesting... I've heard of it in intelligence reports. Apparently Morgana sometimes suspend ships they've "sunk" near the surface. No one knows how or why.
Well now, that is rather intriguing oui? It also sounded like that merchantman was carrying some very valuable cargo. Could we perhaps... send a launch over with a salvaging crew?

Fields.MenuText: You don't strike me as having an interest in salavaging all of the sudden.
It's hard to resist when you're this enthusiastic.
I'm sure the Morganas would be thrilled to happen upon us while our attention is fixated on the wreck.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine, with treasure before us, how could we not plunder the vessel?
Then don't. Just look into my eyes and say yes, pleeeeease.
Then we'll have double the lookouts on the search for any sign of trouble.
I'm worried that the ship will suddenly finish sinking at some point... but fine, bring us alongside and take some volunteers aboard. Save what you can.
Mais bien sûr, Captaine! But of course!
Capitaine, look at all of these crates we've brought over! A rich prize indeed.

Fields.MenuText: Don't exaggerate too much. You're not bringing up gold doubloons.
Prize eh? Now you're sounding a bit like a pirate, eh, Dunkerque?
Maybe wait until you've opened the crates before you start celebrating.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't know what's in these crates. ... Though, it's probably something boring like vegetables. They are rather heavy for vegetables, though...
Un corsair? Capitaine! And here I am worried about denying goods to the enemy!
Imagine if all these crates contained giant hunks of gold. Giant, wet hunks of gold!
I'm going to head back across. I can reach some of the passenger cabins and thought I saw a jewlery box.
Je serai bientôt de retour Capitaine. I'll be back shortly, look after these for me s'il vous plaît?
... I'm a little surprised to see Dunkerque so focused on treasure. It's unlike her.
*ALARM*
Just like pirates to show up in front of treasure. Well, this is one booty you won't be plundering today!
@BATTLE
Welcome to Quebec City, Dunkerque! You know, this is one of the oldest ports in North America. Is it everything you hoped it'd be?
It's loud. Look at all the people! I'm so excited to meet them!
Nothing's stopping you. Go start up a few conversations.
It's shame there's no shops right by the pier. Do you think a couple crew members could pick up some things for me?
I'm certain something can be arranged. First, though, we need to sell all those goods you salvaged.
What are you talking about?
Everything you recovered from the merchant ship.
Oh! I returned all of the crates to the merchants before we came to port. It belonged to them, after all.

Fields.MenuText: Of course you did. That makes more sense.
Why would you do that? The merchants abandoned those crates. That was a lot of money you gave away.
What a kind deed. I hope they were grateful.

Fields.DialogueText: More sense than what?
True but even if we salvaged it fairly, the supplies are for the war, not for lining our coffers.
Oh, they were. They offered to pay me for my services, but the experience was payment enough.
*ALARM*
Looks like souvenir shopping is going to have a to wait a bit. We've got company.
The Morganas are relentless!
@BATTLE
Nothing. You acted perfectly in character, Dunkerque.
Dunkerque, I feel like I owe you an apology.
An apology? What for?
Well, before, when you were so excited to salvage that merchant vessel, I formed the wrong impression.
Quoi? What do you mean the wrong impression?
I thought you were acting out of greed, taking all the goods for yourself. I thought that I was seeing another side of you, but I should've known better. I'm sorry.
Oh? You... you thought that? I... Heh heh... That's... That's absurd.
Are you okay, Dunkerque?
I'm fine. I just think it's really funny that you thought that! Ha Ha HA!

Fields.MenuText: That's not how normal people laugh.
You're breaking into a sweat. Are you sure you're all right?
Well, if you're sure...

Fields.DialogueText: Sure it is! See? Ha Ha HA HA HAHAHAHA! IT's totally normal to laugh like this.
I'm fine. It's just hot out. Or... maybe it's humid. That's it! It's humid. It's the humidity!
I am! One hundred percent! Never better!
(Now let's change the subject. Completely naturally.) Ehh... oh, look! Morganas!
What!?
How conven... I mean, what terrible timing! Come, Capitaine! To arms!
@BATTLE
We're in... Canada, Dunkerque.
Dunkerque, what's going on with you? And don't try saying everything is fine.
I... Everything is... Okay, you're right. Something you said, well... it struck me.
Not in a good way, I'm guessing. Talk to me. What's bothering you?
I guess... You know how we all have a little voice in the back of our heads telling us what's right and wrong?
Sure.
Well, I have another voice that... wants to be free, that wants to do whatever it wants whenever it wants. I want to be free to sail where I want, fight where I want, and do whatever I want!
What's wrong with that?
That's not the kind of behavior that a Belle should have. That's... that's more like a pirate!

Fields.MenuText: You're afraid of being a pirate?
More like the romanticized view of a pirate.
Is it? Who doesn't like freedom?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, not afraid... I mean, I am, but I'm not. It's confusing.
I mean... you're not wrong.
As members of the fleet, we're under others' authority. We're not free.
I've heard horrible stories about pirates. They raid ships, they destroy ports, they kill people. And yet... they're free.
Does envying that freedom make me a bad person, Capitaine?
Dunkerque, you are far from a bad person. Just because you want to be free doesn't mean you're a pirate.
It doesn't?
Real pirates are selfish thieves who disregard the well-being of those around them. That's not you. I don't think you could be a true pirate, even if you wanted to.
Heh, that... that makes me feel a little better. Thanks, Capitaine.
Anytime. What even got that idea in your head in the first place?
My sister made a remark, once. She said something that made me worry I was more pirate than Belle. Although... now I can hardly remember the specifics of what she said.
Well, you can forget about that now. You're a Belle through and through. You're no pirate.
*ALARM*
The Morganas, on the other hand...
Let's show them what this Belle is made of.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, look what I have for you!
Oh, a hat? A very classic design!
Well, I decided I was being silly about my worries about being a pirate... and decided to acquire a pirate's hat.
You did.
Oui! Put it on! Ah! C'est magnifique!

Fields.MenuText: Hmm... I could get used to this.
The feathers might be a bit much.
You know... maybe we could raid some shipping. Just to try it.

Fields.DialogueText: I think you look quite dashing. I rather like how mine looks as well.
The splash of colors really brighten up your uniform though!
Oui capitaine, très drôle. Very funny.
Charmante! A proper pair of adventurers.
... Yay?
The dashing Captain and the charming Belle.
*ALARM*
Looks like the Morganas aren't the biggest fans of our new hats.
Hmph. Just goes to prove those savages have savage taste.
@BATTLE
Dunkerque, I've got some good news.
Oh? What is it, Capitaine? A new adventure, perhaps?
Well. Something like that.
Lovely. What's happening, then?
We've been called back to France. Command will issue us a new assignment once we arrive.
What? Has all the "bad press" faded away already?
Apparently, the higher ups heard word of a certain Belle saving the crew and cargo of a merchant vessel.
Really? They heard about that?
Their cargo was important for the continued war effort against the Morganas.
The fact that it only arrived at its destination because of your efforts was enough to improve your standing in the eyes of Command.
That's... I suppose I should be excited, shouldn't I?

Fields.MenuText: Why wouldn't you be?
Oh, right, you were just starting to enjoy your freedom.
You certainly shouldn't be disappointed. This is a chance for a new adventure.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, a new assignment means saying goodbye to all this newfound freedom.
Exactly. I had so many plans, too. I haven't taken nearly enough pictures!
A new adventure does sound exciting. Though our current adventure hardly had a chance to get started.
*ALARM*
Ugh. If these cursed sea witches would leave us alone for a few minutes, I might actually be able to enjoy something.
Well, take it out on them, not me.
Exactement, Capitaine! Let's sink those foul things and be done with it.
@BATTLE
These Morganas are not giving me much of a challenge today.
Let's not tempt fate, Dunkerque.
@BATTLE
All right, Dunkerque, it's time to get moving.
It's already time to go back to France? I thought we had more time. There's still so much I want to do!
Don't panic. While we're on our way, we're going to do our best to accomplish everything on your to-do list before we arrive at our destination.
What? Really? You haven't seen my list, it's pretty long.

Fields.MenuText: I think, with the two of us working together, there's nothing we can't handle.
How long? Let me get a look at this thing before I make any promises.
All the more reason to hurry.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh, you know what? I think you might be right.
Well, I haven't written anything down, but I've been thinking about it for a while now.
You're not wrong! There's no time to waste!
I want to make sure there are no lingering regrets when we arrive in France, so whatever you want to do, I say we do it now.
Whatever I want to do?
Anything.
I'm going to hold you to that, Capitaine. This is one time when I think I will lead the way.
Woah, hey, Dunkerque, you don't have to pull me by the collar, I'm coming willingly!
Not fast enough! You said it yourself, we've got to get moving!
*ALARM*
It won't be long until we reach France, Dunkerque. This is your last chance to go rogue.
Stop making jokes. I'm ready for our next adventure, Capitaine.
You're sure you're not going to miss all the freedom?
I might not have absolute freedom... but I'll have enough. Especially as long as you're my capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: You're probably right. I can never say no to you.
Really? You think I'm that much of a pushover?
I'm not going to let you do whatever you want, you know. I'm still the captain.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. And why would you ever want to? I have the best ideas!
I never said you were a pushover. You did, but I didn't.
Sure sure, and I'm still the ship. We could have this argument all day.
Now do you think we could raid a few ships before we arrive? As one last hurrah?
You're joking, right?
Of course. ... Unless we run into any ships that look like they deserve it.
Dunkerque...?
I'm joking! Don't look at me like that. It's all a joke. Mostly.
You're having too much fun messing with me.
What can I say? You're fun to mess with.
Not as fun as those Morganas, though.
